The '''Aeger's Hide +3''' is an enchanted [[Hide Armor|hide armor]] which provides a cumulative 15% resistance against fire, cold and acid. This armor also grants the wearer immunity to [[Confusion (disambiguation)|confusion]]. Opposed to common hide armor, the Aeger's one doesn't apply penalties to a [[thief]]'s [[Thieving Abilities|abilities]] due to its lower weight.

== Location ==

* One piece is sold by [[Ribald Barterman]] at the [[Adventurer Mart]], [[Waukeen's Promenade]], as part of his usual display.

==Description==

{{quote|This heavy and thick [[bear]] [[Hide Armor|hide]] is all that remains of the fabled [[Aeger]]. Several hundred years ago, the Aeger, a giant bear, terrorized hundreds of small villages up and down the [[Sword Coast]]. The bear was invulnerable to fire, cold, or acid. Finally the young men and women of several villages banded together, forming a militia almost two hundred people strong. The Aeger was surrounded and finally slain. Less than a dozen villagers survived, and they carved the Aeger's hide amongst themselves. Out of one of the pieces this armor was created.}}
== Gameplay ==

* The [[Avenger]]s' inability of wearing this specific [[Hide Armor]] was only added in the game's ''[[Baldur's Gate II: Enhanced Edition|Enhanced Edition]]'' – in the classic ''[[Baldur's Gate II: Shadows of Amn|Shadows of Amn]]'' this [[Druid]] kit is allowed to equip the Aeger's Hide.
* The displayed [[Mind Shield]] only makes immune to [[Confusion (disambiguation)|Confusion]], not other mind affecting [[spells]], such as [[Charm Person]] or [[Domination]].
* The elemental resistances of 15% are cumulative.
